text: to get a PhD people spend four or five
sometimes even six years of their life
really focusing on a problem that I call
it a laser focus is intense it's
probably more intense than anything else
people will do in their life but when
you're done you have to get back into
the real world you have to get a job you
have to eat every day and take care of
all those attendant bills you need
something besides just getting higher
you need to actually have the overall
set of skills too we use the term before
play in the playground with all the
other folks and so Paul Mendes my coach
my my symposium organizer here and I
have conceived of this a while back and
thought you know there's probably a need
for this within the within the ACS and
we hope we found that there's a cynic
who says you've had a job for a long
time I'm looking for a job right now
what can you possibly offer me the
people that you you claimed well you've
already had a job for a long time those
will be the people hiring you those will
be the people with whom you work and for
whom you work and so you need to get to
know how to talk to them work with them
see what your interests are and theirs
are and how they mesh we're not only
excited that we've got a symposium today
but we're very fortunate when we feel
flattered that we have been okayed for
turning this into an ACS symposium
series book that also is a big help
because there were some corporate
chemist friends of ours as well as
government lab friends of ours who are
not able to make it to the meeting today
they're still able to put in chapters
and so we hope that by the end of 2014
we're going to have a book with a lot of
breadth to it that has academic
understanding and viewpoints corporate
understanding and viewpoints as well as
the government lab
understanding and viewpoints so we think
we'll have a very good volume at the end
of those
